camel.sink.path.operation.name: camel.sink.path.operation
camel.sink.path.operation.description: Which operation to use One of: [events] [stats] [auth] [info] [ping] [version] [imagebuild] [imagecreate] [imageinspect] [imagelist] [imagepull] [imagepushimageremove] [imagesearch] [imagetag] [containerattach] [containercommit] [containercopyfile] [containercreate] [containerdiffinspectcontainer] [containerkill] [containerlist] [containerlog] [containerpause] [containerrestart] [containerremove] [containerstartcontainerstop] [containertop] [containerunpause] [containerwait] [execcreate] [execstart]

camel.sink.endpoint.email.name: camel.sink.endpoint.email
camel.sink.endpoint.email.description: Email address associated with the user

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.cmdExecFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cmdExecFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.cmdExecFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the DockerCmdExecFactory implementation to use

camel.sink.endpoint.parameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.parameters
camel.sink.endpoint.parameters.description: Additional configuration parameters as key/value pairs

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.certPath.name: camel.sink.endpoint.certPath
camel.sink.endpoint.certPath.description: Location containing the SSL certificate chain

camel.component.docker.configuration.name: camel.component.docker.configuration
camel.component.docker.configuration.description: To use the shared docker configuration

camel.component.docker.email.name: camel.component.docker.email
camel.component.docker.email.description: Email address associated with the user

camel.component.docker.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.docker.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.docker.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.docker.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.docker.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.docker.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.docker.cmdExecFactory.description: The fully qualified class name of the DockerCmdExecFactory implementation to use

camel.component.docker.parameters.name: camel.component.docker.parameters
